original: I found your dossier in the Thalmor Embassy.
string: 我在梭默大使馆找到了你的档案。

original: Did you, now?
string: 是吗？

original: Not many walked into those witches' den and came out alive - even fewer made it into my city to tell their stories.
string: 能从那帮女巫的老窝里活着出来，甚至还能走进我的城市里，讲他们故事的人——着实不多。

original: Tell me, then. What do the Thalmor have to say about me?
string: 那就说说看吧，梭默对我有什么评价？

original: It says you're the Thalmor's asset.
string: 那上面说你是梭默的走狗。

original: I see. But tell me - what do you think of such claims?
string: 我知道。不过告诉我——你对这些说法怎么看？

original: I think they were lies.
string: 我觉得他们在说谎。

original: I appreciate your faith. But the truth has always been more complicated than that.
string: 我对你的信任表示感激。可真相从来都比那更复杂。

original: I think they were telling the truth. They didn't have to lie on their dossier.
string: 我觉得他们说的是实话。他们没必要在档案上撒谎。

original: Your war weakened humanity. You're doing exactly what the Thalmor want.
string: 你的战争削弱了人类，而你正做着梭默想做的事。

original: As you say.
string: 就像你说的。

original: I could throw myself against the Imperial Legion or the Aldmeri Dominion, and they'd crush me despite my Voice.
string: 就算我拼死对抗帝国军团或先祖神洲，即便拥有龙吼之力，他们也必会将我碾碎。

original: Or I could take what resources I can get... strengthen my forces before I took a chance against Skyrim's enemies.
string: 或者我可以获取力所能及的资源…在冒险对抗天际的敌人之前先壮大我的势力。

original: I chose the path where I stood a chance.
string: 我选择了那条尚有胜算的道路。

original: Indeed - the Thalmor had a hand in Markarth's events. With their gold, we fought battles that shall become our beginning.
string: 确实——梭默曾插手了马卡斯的事。凭借他们的黄金，我们打赢了必将成为新起点的战役。

original: The truth has always been more complicated than that.
string: 真相从来都比这更复杂。

original: I don't know what to make of it, so I came to hear what you have to say.
string: 我不知道该怎么理解这件事，所以我想听听你的看法。

original: And I appreciate your wisdom. Many are inclined to judge when they see a shadow of what might be the truth.
string: 而我也感谢你的明智。当许多人看到真相的浮光掠影时，总倾向于妄下论断。

original: The truth... has always been more complicated than that.
string: 但真相……往往都比那更复杂。

original: But it's not a conversation we'll have here. Meet me in my quarters, and I shall tell you my side of the story.
string: 但这并非我们在此要谈的话题。到我的住处来，我将向你讲述我的版本。

original: So it's true - you were working for the Thalmor!
string: 所以这是真的——你一直在为梭默工作！

original: No! I'd die before I ever bow to those elves.
string: 不！我宁死也不会向那帮精灵低头。

original: Will you tell me about your dossier's truth now?
string: 现在你愿意告诉我档案里的真相了吧？

original: But that wasn't the whole story, was it?
string: 但这并非事情的全貌，对吧？

original: It wasn't.
string: 不是。

original: When I returned to my homeland, I saw an Empire too cowardly to stem the tides, who allowed the Eagle to swallow our men, our ways - even our god!
string: 当我重返故土，看到的却是一个怯懦到不敢力挽狂澜的帝国——它任由雄鹰吞噬我们的子民，我们的传统，甚至我们的神明！

original: Today, it's the Thalmor; the next, it'd just be another foe. The Empire's existence would drag the world to its grave, my beloved Skyrim included.
string: 今天是梭默，而明天，又会出现另一个敌人。帝国的存在会将世界拖入坟墓，包括我深爱的天际。

original: And yet, I was but one man. A droplet against the stone that was the Ruby Throne.
string: 然而，我不过是一介凡人。如同冲击红钻王座这块顽石的一滴水珠。

original: It was then... a helping hand reached out. That of the beast who threatened to consume my fatherland.
string: 就在那时……一只援手伸了过来。正是那只曾威胁要吞噬我祖国的野兽。

original: The Thalmor.
string: 梭默。

original: They'd give me the gold to equip my followers, hire bards to spread our word - anything that helps them corrode the Empire from within.
string: 他们会给我黄金来装备我的追随者，雇佣吟游诗人传播我们的理念——任何能从内部腐蚀帝国的手段他们都愿意提供。

original: Actually, forget it.
string: 算了，当我没说。

original: And you took their gold.
string: 所以你还收了他们的黄金。

original: So you did what the Thalmor wanted you to do.
string: 所以你做了梭默想让你做的事。

original: I believe you had your reason.
string: 我相信你有自己的理由。

original: But your war weakens humanity against the Thalmor.
string: 但你的战争却削弱了人类们对抗梭默的力量。

original: Or I have made it stronger by ridding it of a corrupt regime. The Empire failed against the Dominion even with its resources and numbers.
string: 不如说我是在清除腐败而使其更加强大。帝国可是对先祖神州落败了，即便他们有着更多的资源和兵源。

original: Yet Hammerfell - once free of its Imperial shackles - was able to cast those elves away from their deserts.
string: 而落锤——他们一摆脱帝国的枷锁——就将那帮精灵逐出了他们的沙漠。

original: It was no mere luck. The truth is that the Empire, with all its noble houses, hierarchy and bureaucracy, had grown too big and deep to be efficient.
string: 这绝不是偶然。事实上，帝国连同他们所有的上层贵族，等级制度和官僚体系，早已臃肿复杂，效率低下。

original: The truth is that we can defeat the Thalmor - but we can only do so without the Empire's corrupt ways.
string: 真相是——我们能够击败梭默——但唯有摒弃帝国的腐败才能做到。

original: So what happens to me now? I've known your secret.
string: 那你打算怎么处置我？我已经知道了你的秘密。

original: You'll return to your duties as my soldier, and I expect you to keep your knowledge to yourself.
string: 你将回归岗位继续担任我的士兵，而我要求你对所知之事守口如瓶。

original: You'll go about your business as you were, unless you give my guards a reason to revoke your freedom.
string: 你将如常处理自己的事务，除非你给我的卫兵提供剥夺你自由的理由。

original: Why allow me to walk free?
string: 为什么放我自由离开？

original: Because deep down, you only sought the truth. Deep down, I know you love this land at least as much as I do.
string: 因为你的内心深处，不过是想找到一个真相。我知道的，你对这片土地的热爱丝毫不逊于我。

original: You're a child of Skyrim, because you're one of us.
string: 你是个天际的孩子，因为你就是我们的一员。

original: You're a child of Skyrim, even if you're not one of us.
string: 你是个天际的孩子，即便并非我们族人。

original: I will go then, Jarl Ulfric.
string: 那我就先告退了，乌弗瑞克领主。

original: Now leave. I wish a moment of peace.
string: 走吧，我想我需要点时间静静。

original: One day, our blades will meet.
string: 终有一日，我们的刀锋将会相遇。

original: And I look forward to that day... Whatever the circumstances that may be by then.
string: 我期待着那天……无论届时会是何种境况。

original: You made it this far. It's only right that you're rewarded with this knowledge.
string: 你能走到这一步，这份知识便是你应得的奖赏。

original: Can you tell me something about your personal life, Jarl Ulfric?
string: 乌弗瑞克领主，能和我聊聊您的私人生活吗？

original: I don't recall being your close friend. If it's a chat you desire, why don't you go talk to an innkeeper?
string: 我可不记得我和你什么交情。想闲聊的话，怎么不去找酒馆的老板聊聊？

original: Of course, my friend. You've more than proven yourself to me... It's only right that you know your liege better.
string: 当然，我的朋友。你早就向我充分证明了你的价值……你理应更了解你的君主。

original: Have you ever had a family?
string: 您曾有过家人吗？

original: Yes. I once did.
string: 是的。我曾有过。

original: I was father to three proud warriors and the finest maiden in all of Eastmarch.
string: 我曾是三位骄傲战士的父亲，也是整个东陲最优秀少女的父亲。

original: What happened to them?
string: 他们后来怎么样了?

original: My sons... They're in the halls of Sovngarde now, with their grandfathers, their comrades - and all who gave their lives to our cause.
string: 我的儿子们…他们现在已身处松加德殿堂，与他们的祖父，战友——以及所有为我们的事业献出生命的人们同在。

original: But my daughter Gunnhild... she was murdered in cold blood by Imperial assassins. She never deserved her fate.
string: 但我的女儿贡希尔德……她被帝国刺客的冷血杀害。她根本不该遭遇这样的命运。

original: Your daughter was killed by Imperial assassins?
string: 您的女儿是被帝国刺客杀害的？

original: Apparently, a few guards had sold their honor to the Empire and let those assassins in.
string: 显然，有几名守卫出卖了荣誉投靠帝国，放那些刺客混了进来。

original: My daughter and I were dining alone when that happened. Those bastards charged at me, their blades poised at my throat-
string: 事发时我和女儿正在独自用餐。那群混蛋突然冲了过来，刀刃直抵我的喉咙——

original: And Gunnhild... my little daughter, she was in the way.
string: 而贡希尔德……我的小女儿，她挡在了那里。

original: Those Imperials were heartless.
string: 那些帝国狗真是冷酷无情。

original: And you'd be right, because I fed their hearts to the wolves after the murder.
string: 你说得没错，因为谋杀之后，我就把他们的心喂给了狼。

original: All your children would still be alive if you hadn't started this war.
string: 若是您没有发动这场战争，您所有的孩子都还能活着。

original: And that's the price I must pay for my fatherland... However it may grieve me.
string: 这就是我必须为祖国付出的代价……无论这让我多么悲痛。

original: Ysgramor lost his sons to the elves and the seas, yet he would claim Skyrim for us.
string: 伊斯格拉默的儿子们葬身于精灵与大海，但他终将为我们夺回天际。

original: When we finally defeat the Empire and the Thalmor... It will be time for me to grieve for my children in peace.
string: 当我们最终击败帝国与梭默时……我便能安然为我的孩子们哀悼了。

original: Let's talk about something else.
string: 让我们聊点别的。

original: What about your wife?
string: 那您的妻子呢？

original: She was an honorable woman, and a fearsome shield-maiden. Back in those days, everyone said she met her lesser half.
string: 她是位可敬的女性，也是位令人敬畏的盾女。那时的人们都说，她遇到了配不上自己的另一半。

original: Indeed. If she had chosen to make her life on the battlefield instead of this palace... She would've been happier.
string: 确实。倘若她选择在战场上而非这座宫殿里度过一生……她本会更快乐些。

original: The world may have forgotten her stories, but I won't. Her smiles, her wrath, and when she spent her last to bring our daughter to this world.
string: 世人或许早已遗忘她的故事，但我不会。她的微笑，她的怒火，还有她倾尽所有将女儿带到这个世界时——那一刻的模样。

original: Who will succeed you if you fall?
string: 倘若有朝一日您倒下了，谁又将接替您的位置？

original: I've been eyeing on a worthy successor. Someone who can lead Skyrim to victory, keep our homeland safe from those who'd conquer it.
string: 我一直在物色一位合格的继任者。一位能带领天际走向胜利，守护我们家园不被征服者蹂躏的人。

original: I've been eyeing on a few senior commanders. Someone who can lead Skyrim to victory, keep our homeland safe from those who'd conquer it.
string: 我一直在物色几位资深的指挥官。必须有人能带领天际走向胜利，保卫我们的家园免遭他人蹂躏。

original: When I pick a successor, I ask that you remain faithful to them as you are to me, for I will have trusted them with our kingdom.
string: 当我选定继任者时，我要求你像忠于我一样忠于他们，因为我将把我们的王国托付于他们。

original: And I think I'm looking at him.
string: 而我认为我正看着他。

original: And I think I'm looking at her.
string: 而我认为我正看着她。

original: Why me?
string: 为什么是我？

original: You are the Dragonborn. In your veins flows the blood that once fueled Talos's holy war.
string: 你是龙裔。你的血脉中流淌着曾为塔洛斯的圣战提供力量的血液。

original: Your name alone will be a rallying call to every Nord, and your deeds an inspiration to those who value honor and courage.
string: 仅凭你的名字就足以号召所有诺德人，而你的壮举将激励所有珍视荣誉与勇气之人。

original: I cannot think of a more fitting leader for our kingdom.
string: 我想不到还有谁更适合领导我们的王国了。

original: What about your own kin?
string: 那您的亲人呢？

original: My children... They are all with Shor now.
string: 我的孩子们……他们现在都与舒尔同在。

original: But even if they were still alive, their blood alone wouldn't make them worthy kings or queens.
string: 但即便他们还活着，仅凭血统也无法使他们成为合格的国王或女王。

original: Yours is different, for your blood came from the Divines instead of ordinary men.
string: 但你不同，你的血脉源自圣灵而非凡人。

original: I promise you, Jarl Ulfric.
string: 我向您保证，乌弗瑞克领主。

original: Thank you, my friend.
string: 谢谢你，我的朋友。

original: We'll see.
string: 等着瞧。

original: I hope that's not a hint of ambition... But I believe in your wisdom, my friend.
string: 我希望这不是野心作祟……但我相信你的智慧，我的朋友。

original: Thank you for your trust, Jarl Ulfric.
string: 感谢您的信任，乌弗瑞克领主。

original: No. Thank you for preserving the fruit of our struggle, and becoming the king my homeland deserves.
string: 不。感谢你守护了我们为之奋斗的果实，成为我故土应有的君王。

original: No. Thank you for preserving the fruit of our struggle, and becoming the queen my homeland deserves.
string: 不。感谢你守护了我们为之奋斗的果实，成为我故土应有的女王。

original: Of course, there's still much for you to learn in the ways of governing and politics... But you already have a seasoned mentor, have you not?
string: 当然，在治国理政方面你还有许多需要学习的……不过你已经有位经验丰富的导师了，不是吗？

original: I don't know if I'm worthy...
string: 我不知道自己是否配得上……

original: If the Dragonborn and the Stormblade is not worthy, then by what right can anyone take the throne?
string: 如果连“龙裔”与“风暴之刃”都不配，那么还有谁有资格坐上那王座？

original: I don't want it.
string: 我不想要。

original: It's a pity. But hopefully, my years remain long enough for you to change your mind. Until then, I will make sure my heir inherits a strong Skyrim.
string: 这很遗憾。但愿我的余生足够长久，足以让你改变心意。在那之前，我必将确保我的继任者接掌一个强盛的天际。

original: We've won the Civil War, but are the fightings truly over?
string: 我们赢得了内战，但战斗真的结束了吗？

original: It's a good question, and one I'm glad veterans like you are asking.
string: 这是个好问题，我很高兴像你这样的老兵能提出这样的问题。

original: Skyrim was battered by dragons, bandits, and Daedric cults while we had our gaze at the war.
string: 当我们专注于战争时，天际正遭受着巨龙，强盗与迪德拉教派的蹂躏。

original: Soon enough, the Dominion's gluttonous maw will encroach our lands; and all the while, Imperial opportunists remain eager to continue the bloodshed.
string: 要不了多久，先祖神州的贪婪血口就会蚕食我们的土地;而帝国投机分子却始终热衷于延续这场血腥的杀戮。

original: What will it take to protect Skyrim's independence?
string: 要如何才能守护天际的独立？

original: We'll need more than courage and the gods' favor.
string: 我们需要的不仅是勇气与诸神的眷顾。

original: First, we must rebuild our economy. Only with a plentiful vault can we afford more armors, and only with a filled stomach can a soldier fight wars.
string: 首先，我们必须重振经济。唯有国库充盈，我们才能购置更多盔甲;唯有粮草充足，士兵才能征战沙场。

original: Second, we'll need reliable allies. The Nords are proud and mighty warriors, but it'll take numbers and resources to end the Aldmeri threat for good.
string: 其次，我们需要可靠的盟友。诺德人是骄傲而强大的战士，但要彻底终结先祖神州的威胁，还需要足够的人力和资源。

original: Who would make a good ally?
string: 谁会是可靠的盟友呢？

original: I have my eyes set on Hammerfell. They stopped the Thalmor once, and with a powerful Nord army at their side, we may even march to Alinor's gates.
string: 我已将目光投向落锤。他们曾阻挡过梭默的脚步，如今若能与强大的诺德军队并肩作战，我们甚至能直抵艾琳诺的城门。

original: But I've also been informed that it's suffering from numerous local conflicts. Random, destructive attacks by the group called "the Alik'r Warriors".
string: 但同时我也获悉，那里正遭受众多地方冲突的困扰。名为“阿里克'尔战士”的团体正发动随机的破坏性袭击。

original: I'll have to study their situation at length. Perhaps we'll help the Alik'r to take over, or perhaps the Crowns would make a more stable ally.
string: 我必须深入研究他们的处境。或许我们会协助阿里克'尔夺取政权，又或许王冠派会成为更可靠的盟友。

original: And then - we'll see how High Rock reacts to our alliance. They may join us as a worthy, willing ally, or we'll free them from the Empire's clutch.
string: 届时——我们便能见证高岩对我们联盟的反应。他们或许会作为值得信赖的自愿盟友加入我们，抑或我们将他们从帝国的掌控中解放出来。

original: Wars and more wars.
string: 又是接踵而至的战争。

original: My friend - we live in the Fourth Era. Wars are the norm, and the mothers always mourn... But our wars just might change that.
string: 我的朋友——我们生活在第四纪元。战争是常态，而母亲们永远在哀悼……但我们的战争或许能改变这一切。

original: What do you plan to do with High Rock?
string: 你打算怎么处理高岩？

original: With our victory, High Rock has become an exclave to the Empire. Cut off from Cyrodiil, it will soon have to seek better friends.
string: 随着我们的胜利，高岩已成为帝国的飞地。与希罗帝尔隔绝后，它很快将不得不寻求更可靠的盟友。

original: I pray that the Bretons will see reason. But if not, I will not suffer being surrounded by Imperial armies from the west and the south.
string: 我祈祷布莱顿人能明事理。但若他们执迷不悟，我绝不会容忍帝国军队从西面和南面包围我们。

original: What can you tell me about Rolff Stone-Fist?
string: 关于罗尔夫·石拳，你能告诉我些什么？

original: Aye, he's my brother, and I don't much take pride from admitting that.
string: 是啊，他是我兄弟，不过我可不怎么以承认这点为荣。

original: But he and I share a father - what can I do but to keep him alive?
string: 但我和他同父异母——除了保全他的性命，我还能做什么呢？

original: You shared a father? What about your mother?
string: 你们的父亲是同一个人？那么你们的母亲呢？

original: Ha! No. My stepmother was a woman from Winterhold. Married into Clan Stone-Fist for the prestige, you see.
string: 哈！不。我的继母是位来自冬堡的女子。她嫁入了石拳氏族，纯粹是为了攀附权势，你懂的吧。

original: Like mother, like son, I'd say.
string: 要我说，有其母必有其子。

original: What makes you say that?
string: 你为何这么说？

original: His mother knew nothing but hate and greed.
string: 他的母亲只懂得仇恨与贪婪。

original: I could excuse that if she at least knew how to fight like a Nord. But it seemed all she knew was being a lazeabout and yelling to the air.
string: 如果她至少懂得如何像诺德人那样战斗，我或许还能原谅她。可她似乎只会游手好闲，对着空气大吼大叫。

original: No doubt, my "brother" learned all his habits from that woman.
string: 毫无疑问，我那位“兄弟”所有习惯都是从那个女人那里学来的。

original: You don't seem to like your brother.
string: 你似乎不太喜欢你兄弟。

original: Like? I'd kick that milk-drinker back to Winterhold if he didn't have my name.
string: 喜欢？要不是那个吃奶的软蛋冠着我的姓氏，我早把他踹回冬堡了。

original: He eats and gambles all day, and he refuses to even join the Stormcloaks. His favorite pass-time? Making troubles for his brother.
string: 他整天除了吃喝就是赌博，甚至不愿加入风暴斗篷。你猜他最喜欢什么消遣？给他兄弟找麻烦。

original: Army life would chew my brother up easily, and I take all the pleasure in seeing that. But of course, Rolff has half the wit to know that.
string: 军队生活会轻易吞噬我的兄弟，而我对此乐在其中。当然，罗尔夫还算有点自知之明。

original: Want me to... "remove" him?
string: 需要我…"除掉"他吗？

original: I don't like what you are trying to say.
string: 我不喜欢你话里的意思。

original: Milk-drinker or not, he is a Stone-Fist, and I will keep him alive by my father's honor.
string: 不管他是不是个喝奶的软蛋，他终究是石拳氏族的人。凭我父亲的荣誉起誓，我定会护他周全。

original: But rough him up, show him the real world - that, I will allow.
string: 但给他点苦头吃，让他见识下真实的世界——这点，我倒是可以允许。

original: Let's talk about something else.
string: 让我们聊点别的。

original: Good.
string: 很好。

original: You should be rougher on him.
string: 你该对他更严厉点。

original: And for what? I have far more important business than fixing a broken cart.
string: 那又是为了什么？比起修理破车，我还有更要紧的事要办。

original: Ulfric is a strong man, but he can't run an army all by himself. As long as my brother is alive, I won't waste my time on a lost cause.
string: 乌弗瑞克是个强者，但他不可能独自统率整支军队。要是我兄长还活着，我绝不会把时间浪费在必败的战局上。

original: A Stormcloak was imprisoned by the Thalmor in Northwatch Keep.
string: 一名风暴斗篷士兵被梭默关押在北望堡垒。

original: The gall of those elves! To take our soldiers and claim a fort on our land?
string: 这些精灵真是厚颜无耻！竟敢抓走我们的士兵，还声称要在我们的土地上占领一座堡垒？

original: I will send a small force to aid your rescue. No son of Skyrim's should be held against his will by a foreign invader.
string: 我会派遣一支小部队协助你们的营救行动。天际的子民绝不应被外来侵略者强行扣押。

original: Leave no Thalmor alive.
string: 不留任何梭默活口。

original: The gall of those elves! To take our soldiers and claim a fort on our land?
string: 这些精灵真是厚颜无耻！竟敢抓走我们的士兵，还声称要在我们的土地上占领一座堡垒？

original: I wish we could do something to save him, but Haafingar remains out of our reach. For now, you must do it in discreet.
string: 我真希望我们能做点什么来救他，但海芬加领实在太远了。眼下，你必须谨慎行事。

original: I believe in you, soldier.
string: 我相信你，士兵。

original: Why do you fight for Ulfric?
string: 你为何为乌弗瑞克而战？

original: Clan Stone-Fist have always been staunch allies to Clan Stormcloak, and I've known Ulfric since we grew our first teeth.
string: 石拳氏族一直是风暴斗篷氏族的坚定盟友，我和乌弗瑞克从刚长乳牙时就认识了。

original: I know this man more than I know myself. He alone has the will and strength to release Skyrim from Cyrodiil's yoke.
string: 我对他的了解要胜过自己。唯有他拥有将天际从希罗帝尔枷锁中解放出来的意志与力量。

original: And by Talos, I will give whatever it takes to see the Empire dead and Skyrim freed.
string: 以塔洛斯之名，我愿付出一切，只为见证帝国覆灭，天际自由。

original: Why the hate for the Empire?
string: 你为什么这么憎恨帝国？

original: Why don't I tell you a story of my own time in the Great War?
string: 要不我给你讲讲我在浩大战争时的亲身经历？

original: Thirty years ago, I sold everything I owned to buy what I needed for the war, then donated the rest to the war chest.
string: 三十年前，我变卖了所有家当购置军需物资，并将剩余的钱财全部捐作军饷。

original: I fought hard, and the Thalmor struck back even harder, but I persevered - because to falter was to lose my homeland and fail the Emperor.
string: 我奋力作战，梭默的反击却更为猛烈，但我坚持了下来——因为一旦退缩，就会失去家园并辜负皇帝的期望。

original: But soon, I found out the Emperor never much cared what we think.
string: 但很快我就发现，皇帝根本不在乎我们的想法。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你是什么意思？

original: When the Thalmor knocked on the Imperial City's gates, the Emperor was swift to make a run and leave all its people to rot.
string: 当梭默敲响帝都大门时，皇帝便仓皇逃窜，任由所有子民自生自灭。

original: But I did not leave with him. I defied my commander and stayed with my people - those who had no swords or shields.
string: 但我并未随他离去。我违抗了指挥官的命令，选择与我的人民同在——那些手无寸铁的人们。

original: You deserted the army.
string: 你当了逃兵。

original: Aye. What use is an army that wouldn't stand for its people?
string: 是啊。一支不愿为人民而战的军队，又有何用？

original: Did you save anyone?
string: 你救下了什么人吗？

original: ...I tried.
string: …我尽力了。

original: My next memories were all black and red... But I lived. When I woke up, I had to push aside dozens of corpses just to breathe.
string: 我之后的记忆只剩下黑暗与血色……但我活了下来。醒来时，我不得不推开数十具尸体才得以呼吸。

original: Talos only knew how long I've climbed on the corpses until I could gain a view... to realize I was in a mass grave outside the city.
string: 塔洛斯才知道我踩着尸体爬了多久才得以看清——我意识到自己正身在城外的万人坑中。

original: Piles of Imperials, Nords, Redguards, even elves - discarded to the moat like they were dirt. Nameless. Forgotten. Unsung.
string: 成堆的帝国人，诺德人，红卫人，甚至精灵——像垃圾般被丢弃在护城河里。无名无姓。被人遗忘。无人歌颂。

original: And I understood then. The Emperor had murdered them as much as the Thalmor did.
string: 那时我才明白，皇帝的罪行与梭默同样罪不可赦。

original: Is that why you fight? So that no one would be discarded by the Emperor again?
string: 这就是你战斗的原因吗？为了不再有人被皇帝抛弃？

original: I was meant for Sovngarde thirty years ago, but Shor did not receive me. I knew then that I still had purposes to serve.
string: 三十年前我就该前往松加德了，但舒尔并未接纳我。那时我便明白，自己仍有使命需要完成。

original: When I saw Ulfric alive - his heart burning with the same rage as mine? I realized he was my destiny. For him, I would brave Oblivion and return.
string: 当我看到活着的乌弗瑞克——他心中燃烧着与我同样的怒火时。我意识到他就是我的宿命。为了他，我甘愿直面湮灭并安然归来。

original: Until the Emperor's reign on my homeland ends, and a worthy king sits on the throne, my lips will not touch Sovngarde's mead.
string: 在皇帝对我故土的统治结束，一位贤王登上王座之前，我绝不会沾一口松加德的蜜酒。

original: I've received troubling news from Riften.
string: 我从裂谷城收到了令人不安的消息。

original: The Imperials are mustering their forces on the mountains. It may be signs of a new invasion from Cyrodiil.
string: 帝国军队正在山脉集结兵力。这可能是赛洛迪尔发动新入侵的征兆。

original: Maven Black-Briar is going to attend a Colovian soiree. The woman's always been cozy with the Empire.
string: 玛雯。黑荆棘将参加一场科洛文晚宴。这女人向来与帝国关系亲密。

original: Some elves have been skulking about in the forests, ambushing our patrols. It may be the Thalmor.
string: 有些精灵一直在森林里鬼鬼祟祟地活动，伏击我们的巡逻队。可能是梭默的人。

original: Strange elven hunters have set up camps in the forests, attacking any passer by. I think they are the Thalmor's agents.
string: 奇怪的精灵猎人在森林中设立了营地，袭击任何路过者。我认为他们是梭默的特工。

original: Send words to Jarl Laila. We'll make sure it does not become a threat.
string: 向莱拉领主传话。我们会确保它不会构成威胁。

original: I trust you know what to do, my friend.
string: 我相信你知道该怎么做，我的朋友。

original: Aye, my Jarl.
string: 遵命，我的领主。

original: I've received troubling news from Solitude.
string: 我从独孤城收到了令人不安的消息。

original: It seems the Imperials are sending Erikur funds. He could use the gold to build a rebellion in Haafingar.
string: 看来帝国正在向埃瑞库尔输送资金。他可能会用这些金币在海芬加领组建叛乱势力。

original: It seems the Imperials are inviting Erikur to invest in Cyrodiil. He could pull his funds from Skyrim to give to the enemy.
string: 看来帝国正邀请埃瑞库尔投资塞洛迪尔。他可能会从天际撤资转投给敌人。

original: It seems an Imperial general has interests in marrying Erikur's sister Gisli. They could be plotting an alliance - even a coup.
string: 似乎有位帝国将军有意迎娶埃瑞克的妹妹吉丝莉。他们可能在策划结盟——甚至是一场政变。

original: Erikur is a reasonable man. The Imperials are wasting their coin and effort.
string: 埃里克是个明事理的人。帝国完全是在浪费他们的金币和精力。

original: Erikur is a man of benefits, not of faith - and right now, his benefits lie with us.
string: 埃里克是个重利而非重信之人——而眼下，他的利益与我们一致。

original: I have said this many times. Marry Torygg's widow and smother the embers of conflict.
string: 这话我说过很多次了。娶了托依格的遗孀，彻底扑灭冲突的火种。

original: No. She will grieve for her man in peace, and that is final.
string: 不行。她会安安静静地哀悼她的男人，这事就这么定了。

original: How is Thongvor faring on Markarth's throne?
string: 依格蒙德在马卡斯城的王座上过得如何？

original: How is the situation in the Reach?
string: 瑞驰领的局势如何？

original: The Forsworn continue to disturb our patrols, but soon, we will bring order to the Reach.
string: 弃誓者仍在滋扰我们的巡逻队，但很快，我们就会让瑞驰领恢复秩序。

original: The Silver-Bloods have proven to be good allies. The flow of silver allows us to better equip our soldiers.
string: 银血家族已被证明是优秀的盟友。白银的流通让我们能更好地装备士兵。

original: The Reachmen are growing bolder by the day in Markarth. My men are prepared to suppress any revolt.
string: 马卡斯城的瑞驰人日益猖獗。我的部下已做好镇压任何叛乱的准备。

original: I can always rely on you, Galmar.
string: 我总能指望你，加尔玛。

original: Let no one take the Reach from us.
string: 绝不让任何人夺走我们的瑞驰。

original: Good. If Thongvor needs anything, tell me and I will provide.
string: 很好。如果依格蒙德需要任何东西，告诉我，我会提供。

original: How is Sorli faring on Morthal's throne?
string: 索莉在莫萨尔城的王座上过得如何？

original: I'll be honest with you - many are questioning her ability to rule.
string: 坦白说——现在有很多人质疑她的执政能力。

original: She just sits her arse on the throne, doing nothing.
string: 她就一屁股坐在王座上，什么都不干。

original: She wasn't the best ruler around, but there were few choices in a place like Hjaalmarch. Just help her how you see fit.
string: 她并不是最好的统治者，但在希雅陲领这种地方本就没多少选择余地。你就尽你所能帮助她吧。

original: Just help her rule. Rule for her, if need be.
string: 协助她的统治，如果有必要话，就替她统治。

original: Aye. But I have a feeling we are sinking our resources into the swamps.
string: 是啊。但我有种感觉，我们正把资源白白浪费在沼泽地里。
